actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on HELP.

committees.committee: Senate Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions

official_title: A bill to improve health care quality and reduce health care costs by establishing a National Fund for Health Research that would significantly expand the Nation's investment in medical research.
short_title: National Fund for Health Research Act
subjects: Department of Health and Human Services

summary.text: National Fund for Health Research Act - Establishes the National Fund for Health Research in the Treasury. Transfers to the Fund amounts equivalent to certain percentages of all premiums received by each health plan for each calendar year and transferred to the Treasury. Mandates distributions from the Fund to the National Institutes of Health, the National Center for Research Resources, and for carrying out specified Public Health Service Act provisions relating to health information communications. Excludes amounts in the Fund from consideration or enforcement with regard to the Congressional Budget Act of 1974 or the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985 (Gramm-Rudman-Hollings Act).

titles.title: National Fund for Health Research Act
A bill to improve health care quality and reduce health care costs by establishing a National Fund for Health Research that would significantly expand the Nation's investment in medical research.
